metadata.title: CVE-2021-3612 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory write flaw was found in the Linux kernel's joystickdevices subsystem in versions before 5.9-rc1, in the way the user callsioctl JSIOCSBTNMAP. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system orpossibly escalate their privileges on the system. The highest threat fromthis vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-lowlatency - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-aws - 4.4.0-1099.104
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.104').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1').
